text: it's a moment of pivotal change in the
Middle East President Obama will make a
major speech on the Arab Spring tomorrow
and next week Prime Minister Netanyahu
of Israel comes to Washington to address
Congress at this moment it's imperative
that President Obama made clear that the
United States stands with its values it
stands with the Universalist aspirations
of Arab people's throughout the region
standing up overcoming their fear
demanding transparency representative
government accountability after decades
of autocracy and despotism like that
practiced by more marga Daffy in Libya
there will be places where the United
States favors more stability like in
Saudi Arabia over change but wherever
there is movement the United States has
to say that it stands with those values
on Israel Palestine it's crunch time
Prime Minister Netanyahu has said
reluctantly that he envisages two states
for two peoples President Obama must
hold him to saying what that means where
will the borders of the Palestinian
state supposed to emerge on the West
Bank be how can that state be reconciled
with the continuation of settlements
that occupy that very land Palestinians
in turn must get serious they must
follow the path set out by Prime
Minister Fayyad renouncing violence
building institutions saying to Israel
than in exchange for that state on the
West Bank it recognizes Israel's right
to live in peace and security
